detail.title: Castleford Mill factory
detail.htmlPage:
Castleford mill factory

The much loved Heritage trench coat is handmade made in Castleford, Yorkshire. We use over 100 individual process. The most intricate is the crafting of the collard which calls for more than 180 stitches to create a fluid curve. It can take up to a year for an individual to learn the sewing technique alone, demonstrating the skill and crasftsmanship we're famous for around the world

At Burberry, great British manufacturing is the foundation, the passion and the essence of everything we are today. Our gabardine and tropical gabardine fabrics are dyed and weven at the Burberry Mill located in Keighley, Yorkshire. Our iconic Heritage trench coat is handmade in Castleford, Yorkshire, using over 100 individual processes. The most intricate of these is the crafting of the collar, which calls for more than 180 stitches to create a fluid curse.

detail.title: Organic Coton
detail.htmlPage:
Bio Farm Coop

Fransico Almeida, Peru

Group: Ecotton (El Carmen, Ica, Peru)

Fransisco spent three years in transition to organic and now been fully organic for tho years. Ecotton provide their organic cotton farmers with ongoing technical support and advice, as weel as offer more stable prices and premiums for their efforts and more ecologically sustainable product.

title: Organic Bio cotton standard
subtitle: Certified by CB's #19862
date: Thu Apr 16 2020 10:06:19 GMT+0200 (heure d’été d’Europe centrale)

detail.title: Organic Bio cotton standard
detail.htmlPage:
aboutorganiccotton.org is a resource space dedicated to spreading the word about organic cotton. The site aims to inform, inspire and equip consumers and retailers with the most credible, up-to-date information available on organic cotton production - from how it's made and where it's produced to the importance of certification and its benefits to farmers and environment. This information is delivered using simple language, yet is backed by reliable, referenced data so that it can be easily followed up and re-used by site visitors.

aboutorganiccotton.org is an initiative by Textile Exchange, a non-profit organization incorporated in 2002. We operate and are committed to the responsible expansion of textile sustainability across the global textile value chain. Textile Exchange is headquartered in the USA with staff and ambassodors located in ten countries.

title: Carbon neutral foot print
subtitle: 100% electricity from renewable sources

detail.title: Carbon neutral foot print
detail.htmlPage:
Zero Footprint Carbon label

Our approach towards Zero

We're making solid progress towards our targets. By the end of 2019, we ahd cut relative carbon emissions at our factoreis byt 30% compared to our 2015 baseline. What's more, 56% of our total electricity consuymption came from renewable sources in 2019. We are working towards corld-class efficiency, through innovating our existing processes and implementing large-scale investment projects. And we are forming both global and local partenerships focused on sharing knowledge and expertise to cut emissions across our value chain.

Zero waste water
Recycling packing
100% electricity from renewable sources
